page.title: 01Woods,Hills Sth of Lochtay
page.content: More than half the area is rough grazing land which rises from 100m to the loch shore to the pecipitous mountain, Greag Ghablu 637m in sq 12. The western side and the north fringe are thickly wooded and there is some reafforestation. Nearly all northern edge of area is covered by Loch Tay. Only road on the south side of loch crosses the area through sqs5,2,3,4,A broad stream, Allt Breaclaict runs north through Sqs 9,10 and 6 into loch in sq 2. where there is a ruined croft. On the loch shore at Fiddlers Bay is a holiday home. The only other habitation is the Edinburgh University Field Centre in sq5. Built in 1968 this is primarily a centre for outdoor sports, and besides it in a small inlet is a 200yr old harbour which the Centre uses.
